page.title: 13BRIDGE OF WEIR - CONCERNS 3
page.content: There is also another{Senior Citizens {Organisation}which is entirely voluntary.It has been going since{6th{ {October 1951.}They have fundraising events which raise money for{summer {trips}and{Christmas dinners.}The summer trip this year is to{St.Andrews and they are hoping it will be a great success. The{Christmas dinners}are{always { popular.}The primary school children entertain the members with songs and carols, accompanied by their brass and recorder groups. They hold fortnightly meetings with a fee of{60p}which also helps to swell the funds. At the meetings they have talks about safety in the home and other subjects which are important to older people. They are also entertained sometimes by a song or two.
